    Serialized Form

    • Package bartMachine

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachine_a_base

        class bartMachine_a_base extends Classifier implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • accept_reject_mh
            boolean[][] accept_reject_mh
            a record of whether each Gibbs sample accepted or rejected the MH step within each of the num_trees trees
          • accept_reject_mh_steps
            char[][] accept_reject_mh_steps
            a record of the proposal of each Gibbs sample within each of the m trees: G, P or C for "grow", "prune", "change"
          • flush_indices_to_save_ram
            boolean flush_indices_to_save_ram
            saves indices in nodes (useful for computing weights)
          • gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees
            bartMachineTreeNode[][] gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees
            all Gibbs samples for burn-in and post burn-in where each entry is a vector of pointers to the num_trees trees in the sum-of-trees model
          • gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees_after_burn_in
            bartMachineTreeNode[][] gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees_after_burn_in
            Gibbs samples post burn-in where each entry is a vector of pointers to the num_trees trees in the sum-of-trees model
          • gibbs_samples_of_sigsq
            double[] gibbs_samples_of_sigsq
            Gibbs samples for burn-in and post burn-in of the variances
          • gibbs_samples_of_sigsq_after_burn_in
            double[] gibbs_samples_of_sigsq_after_burn_in
            Gibbs samples for post burn-in of the variances
          • mem_cache_for_speed
            boolean mem_cache_for_speed
            whether or not we use the memory cache feature See Section 3.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013
          • num_cores
            int num_cores
            how many CPU cores to use during model creation
          • num_gibbs_burn_in
            int num_gibbs_burn_in
            how many Gibbs samples we burn-in for
          • num_gibbs_total_iterations
            int num_gibbs_total_iterations
            how many total Gibbs samples in a BART model creation
          • num_trees
            int num_trees
            the number of trees in our sum-of-trees model
          • seed
            Long seed
            the seed for the random number generator
          • threadNum
            int threadNum
            the current thread being used to run this Gibbs sampler
          • use_xoshiro
            boolean use_xoshiro
            whether or not to use the Xoshiro256PlusPlus random number generator
          • verbose
            boolean verbose
            should we print stuff out to screen?

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachine_b_hyperparams

        class bartMachine_b_hyperparams extends bartMachine_a_base implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • alpha
            double alpha
            A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree independent of depth
          • beta
            double beta
            A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree dependent on depth which makes it more difficult as the tree gets deeper
          • hyper_k
            double hyper_k
            this controls where to set hyper_sigsq_mu by forcing the variance to be this number of standard deviations on the normal CDF
          • hyper_lambda
            double hyper_lambda
            the multiplier of the scale parameter of the inverse gamma prior on the variance
          • hyper_mu_mu
            double hyper_mu_mu
            the center of the prior of the terminal node prediction distribution
          • hyper_nu
            double hyper_nu
            half the shape parameter and half the multiplicand of the scale parameter of the inverse gamma prior on the variance
          • hyper_q
            double hyper_q
            At a fixed hyper_nu, this controls where to set hyper_lambda by forcing q proportion to be at that value in the inverse gamma CDF
          • hyper_sigsq_mu
            double hyper_sigsq_mu
            the variance of the prior of the terminal node prediction distribution
          • interaction_constraints
            HashMap<Integer, it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntOpenHashSet> interaction_constraints
            if a covariate is a key here, the value defines interaction between the variables that are legal
          • sample_var_y
            Double sample_var_y
            the sample variance of the response variable on its original scale
          • y_max
            double y_max
            the maximum of the response variable on its original scale
          • y_min
            double y_min
            the minimum of the response variable on its original scale
          • y_range_sq
            double y_range_sq
            the minimum of the response variable on its original scale

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachine_c_debug

        class bartMachine_c_debug extends bartMachine_b_hyperparams implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • tree_illust
            boolean tree_illust
            should we create illustrations of the trees and save the images to the debug directory?

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachine_g_mh

        class bartMachine_g_mh extends bartMachine_f_gibbs_internal implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • prob_grow
            double prob_grow
            the hyperparameter of the probability of picking a grow step during the Metropolis-Hastings tree proposal
          • prob_prune
            double prob_prune
            the hyperparameter of the probability of picking a prune step during the Metropolis-Hastings tree proposal

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachine_h_eval

        class bartMachine_h_eval extends bartMachine_g_mh implements Serializable

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachine_i_prior_cov_spec

        class bartMachine_i_prior_cov_spec extends bartMachine_h_eval implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • cov_split_prior
            double[] cov_split_prior
            This is a probability vector which is the prior on which covariates to split instead of the uniform discrete distribution by default
          • use_prior_cov_spec
            boolean use_prior_cov_spec
            Do we use this feature in this BART model?

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachineClassification

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachineClassificationMultThread

        class bartMachineClassificationMultThread extends bartMachineRegressionMultThread implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • classification_rule
            double classification_rule
            The value of the classification rule which if the probability estimate of Y = 1 is greater than, we predict 1

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachineRegression

        class bartMachineRegression extends bartMachine_i_prior_cov_spec implements Serializable

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachineRegressionMultThread

        class bartMachineRegressionMultThread extends Classifier implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • alpha
            Double alpha
            A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree independent of depth
          • bart_gibbs_chain_threads
            bartMachineRegression[] bart_gibbs_chain_threads
            the collection of num_cores BART models which will run separate Gibbs chains
          • beta
            Double beta
            A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree dependent on depth which makes it more difficult as the tree gets deeper
          • cov_split_prior
            double[] cov_split_prior
            The probability vector that samples covariates for selecting split rules
          • flush_indices_to_save_ram
            boolean flush_indices_to_save_ram
            saves indices in nodes (useful for computing weights)
          • gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees_after_burn_in
            bartMachineTreeNode[][] gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees_after_burn_in
            this is the combined gibbs samples after burn in from all of the num_cores chains
          • hyper_k
            Double hyper_k
            this controls where to set hyper_sigsq_mu by forcing the variance to be this number of standard deviations on the normal CDF
          • hyper_nu
            Double hyper_nu
            half the shape parameter and half the multiplicand of the scale parameter of the inverse gamma prior on the variance
          • hyper_q
            Double hyper_q
            At a fixed hyper_nu, this controls where to set hyper_lambda by forcing q proportion to be at that value in the inverse gamma CDF
          • interaction_constraints
            HashMap<Integer, it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntOpenHashSet> interaction_constraints
          • mem_cache_for_speed
            boolean mem_cache_for_speed
            whether or not we use the memory cache feature See Section 3.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013
          • num_cores
            int num_cores
            the number of CPU cores to build many different Gibbs chain within a BART model
          • num_gibbs_burn_in
            int num_gibbs_burn_in
            the number of burn-in samples in each Gibbs chain
          • num_gibbs_total_iterations
            int num_gibbs_total_iterations
            the total number of gibbs samples where each chain gets a number of burn-in and then the difference from the total divided by num_cores
          • num_trees
            int num_trees
            the number of trees in this BART model on all Gibbs chains
          • prob_grow
            Double prob_grow
            the hyperparameter of the probability of picking a grow step during the Metropolis-Hastings tree proposal
          • prob_prune
            Double prob_prune
            the hyperparameter of the probability of picking a prune step during the Metropolis-Hastings tree proposal
          • sample_var_y
            Double sample_var_y
            the estimate of some upper limit of the variance of the response which is usually the MSE from a a linear regression
          • seed
            Integer seed
            the seed for the random number generator
          • total_iterations_multithreaded
            int total_iterations_multithreaded
            the total number of Gibbs samples for each of the num_cores chains
          • tree_illust
            boolean tree_illust
          • use_xoshiro
            boolean use_xoshiro
            whether or not to use the Xoshiro256PlusPlus random number generator
          • verbose
            boolean verbose
            should we print select messages to the screen

      • Class bartMachine.bartMachineTreeNode

        class bartMachineTreeNode extends Object implements Serializable

        • Serialized Fields

          • attribute_split_counts
            int[] attribute_split_counts
            a tabulation of the counts of attributes being used in split points in this tree
          • bart
            bartMachine_b_hyperparams bart
            a link back to the overall bart model
          • depth
            int depth
            the generation of this node from the top node (root note has generation = 0 by definition)
          • indicies
            int[] indicies
            the indices in {0, 1, ..., n-1} of the data records in this node
          • isLeaf
            boolean isLeaf
            is this node a terminal node?
          • left
            bartMachineTreeNode left
            the left daughter node
          • parent
            bartMachineTreeNode parent
            the parent node of this node
          • posterior_mean
            double posterior_mean
            the posterior mean in the conditional distribution if applicable (for research purposes only)
          • posterior_var
            double posterior_var
            the posterior variance in the conditional distribution if applicable (for research purposes only)
          • right
            bartMachineTreeNode right
            the right daughter node
          • sendMissingDataRight
            boolean sendMissingDataRight
            send missing data to the right?
          • splitAttributeM
            int splitAttributeM
            the attribute this node makes a decision on
          • splitValue
            double splitValue
            the value this node makes a decision on
          • y_avg
            double y_avg
            the average of the node responses if applicable (for research purposes only)
          • y_pred
            double y_pred
            if this is a leaf node, then the result of the prediction for regression, otherwise null
